greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Part of n composed of prime factors of form 4k+3.
comment: Largest term of A004614 that divides n. - _Peter Munn_, Apr 15 2021
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: a[n_] := Product[{p, e} = pe; If[Mod[p, 4] == 3, p^e, 1], {pe, FactorInteger[n]}]; Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 16 2015, updated May 29 2019 *)
program: (PARI) a(n)=local(f); f=factor(n); prod(k=1, matsize(f)[1], if(f[k, 1]%4<>3, 1, f[k, 1]^f[k, 2]))
return 1 if n == 1 else reduce(mul, [1 if i%4==3 else i**f[i] for i in f])
def a(n): return n/a072436(n) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 08 2017
xref: Equivalent sequence for distinct prime factors: A170819.
Equivalent sequences for prime factors of other forms: A000265 (2k+1), A170818 (4k+1), A072436 (not 4k+3), A248909 (6k+1), A343431 (6k+5).
results.author: _Ralf Stephan_, Aug 30 2004
